experience: You and Akshai J. both know Ketan Patel, Dan Nienhauser, and 42 others

Hey friends! A colleague of mine is trying to figure out how to reduce teachers’ workloads, return some time to them so they can be human and enjoy the beauty their job brings. To best understand how, she needs as many teachers as possible to fill out this short survey; it shouldn’t take more than 5 minutes to complete! Once you’ve completed it, pass it along to any and all classroom teachers you know. Thanks!
A seamless K-college path for students in historically disadvantaged South Phoenix.

With DeansList, schools have the tools to stay on top of all the non-academic info that matters. With this data at their fingertips, teachers and administrators can drive improvements in non-cognitive skills, socio-emotional learning and build "21st century skills" like perseverance, diligence, creative problem solving skills and leadership.
Wonderful City of Phoenix, Great State of Arizona

First 'No Excuses" charter school in AZ, 2012 AZ Charter School of the Year and member of the Excellent Schools Network at Building Excellent Schools. PCA serves over 500 K-12th grade students in South Phoenix with the mission to prepare students to succeed in college and be leaders in our community.
4th/5th grade combination teacher and 1st grade teacher
Course instructor for Educational Assessment to students in ASU M.Ed program for Curriculum and Instruction.

Awarded a Fulbright Grant to study and teach at la Universidad de Concepción in Southern Chile. While teaching pedagogy and English language coursework at the university, Akshai researched US History education in Chile and its impact on Chilean attitudes toward US policy under the guidance of a professor and the host university.
Laveen Elem School Dist - Phoenix, AZ

SOUNDS Academy is a non-profit music education program whose mission is to teach, mentor, and provide musical experiences and opportunities for underserved youth. SOUNDS works with individual students and schools to provide access to quality music education on strings instruments.
Columbia University in the City of New York

Throughout my time as a Teach For America Corps Member, I respected Steven's work in the classroom. He was the type of colleague who listened when discussing ideas and provided critical feedback in a kind way. After his transition into school leadership, he was was very open about the benefits and difficulties of his role. He became a mentor who and  helped me successfully plan my own path to leadership.

Lauren Chamberlain
Deputy Director of Training and Support
March 12, 2009, Akshai J. worked with Lauren in different groups

Lauren Chamberlain has been a spectacular educator throughout her career. Initially, she showed great ability to learn and continuously improve her craft, persevering through a difficult teaching placement. Her students made amazing academic growth thanks to her commitment and hard work.As a behavior interventionist, she had rapport with students in Kindergarten through 8th grade. My students always felt better, understood their mistakes, and had a plan for how they would improve, after speaking with Ms. Chamberlain. She is achievement-driven in all aspects of her work and is a model of character for students at Valley View School.
